column2: Since Vladimir Putin ordered the invasion of Ukraine, more than 13,000 Russians protesting in the streets have been arrested. Correspondent David Pogue talks with a young woman detained for demonstrating against the war; and with a former Parliament Member, forced to leave the country, who describes Putin's efforts to eradicate dissent.
column4: How Russia cracks down on anti-war protests

column2: Source: Robert Kamau / Getty White women are on TikTok appropriating Black women for fun. In a recent post from a white woman with the user name @doonigalli, she was raving about a new thing she was doing with her hair called ‚Äústicky bangs.‚Äù Black women took a collective sigh when we laid eyes on this post because her dry and lifeless looking ‚Äústicky bangs‚Äù was a poor imitation of what Black women have been doing for decades: styling our baby hairs. The woman who uploaded the video is also a serial appropriator whose seen in videos wearing cornrows and braids as well. In another video, she said she was joking about the sticky bangs, which she raved about in a English accent. But we aren‚Äôt laughing. There‚Äôs nothing funny about imitating or mocking our aesthetic. ‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì Alli Fitz have you tho?? have you really?? @doonigalli #stickybangs #stfu #fakeapology üòí ‚ô¨ LOOKA DE BISH BRAIDS ‚Äì ZOLU‚ÄôS DYNASTY @doonigalli how was anyone supposed to find this funny??? ‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì Doonigalli Cultural appropriation is something Black women see far too much. Here‚Äôs five other times non-Black people found appropriation appropriate.

column2: The Museum of Modern Art remains closed Sunday and police are still looking for Gary Cabana, the man accused of stabbing two museum employees. CBS2's Christina Fan reports.
column4: Surveillance video shows MoMA stabbing suspect climb over reception desk
